form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Ayotte (for herself, Mr. Graham, and Mr. Wicker) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To repeal section 403 of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2013, relating to an annual adjustment of retired pay for members of the Armed Forces under the age of 62, and to provide an offset.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Keeping Our Promise to Our Military Heroes Act.

section.header: Repeal of reductions made by Bipartisan Budget Act of 2013

subsection.text: Section 403 of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2013 is repealed as of the date of the enactment of such Act.

subsection.header: Social Security number required To claim the refundable portion of the child tax credit

paragraph.text: Subsection (d) of section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Identification requirement with respect to taxpayer

subparagraph.text: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to any taxpayer for any taxable year unless the taxpayer includes the taxpayerâ€™s Social Security number on the return of tax for such taxable year.
In the case of a joint return, the requirement of subparagraph (A) shall be treated as met if the Social Security number of either spouse is included on such return.
Subparagraph (A) shall not apply to the extent the tentative minimum tax (as defined in section 55(b)(1)(A)) exceeds the credit allowed under section 32.

paragraph.header: Omission treated as mathematical or clerical error
paragraph.text: Subparagraph (I) of section 6213(g)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: an omission of a correct Social Security number required under section 24(d)(5) (relating to refundable portion of child tax credit), or a correct TIN under section 24(e) (relating to child tax credit), to be included on a return,

paragraph.text: Subsection (e) of section 24 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting with respect to qualifying children after Identification requirement in the heading thereof.
The amendments made by this subsection shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
